org.midica.ui.player.soundcheck

Class SoundcheckController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.midica.ui.player.soundcheck.SoundcheckController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.ItemListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener, javax.swing.event.DocumentListener, javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener, javax.swing.event.RowSorterListener

    public class SoundcheckController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener, java.awt.event.ItemListener, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, javax.swing.event.DocumentListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener, javax.swing.event.RowSorterListener

    This class provides the controller and event listener for the soundcheck window. It’s implemented as a singleton.

    Author:
    Jan Trukenm√ºller

    • Method Detail

      • getController

        public static SoundcheckController getController(SoundcheckView scView,
                                                 SoundcheckNoteModel scNoteModel,
                                                 SoundcheckInstrumentModel scInstrModel)

        Creates a SoundcheckController object by calling the private constructor, if not yet done. Returns the object.

        This method is called from outside instead of the constructor itself in order to ensure the singleton behaviour.

        Parameters:
        scView - Soundcheck window.
        scNoteModel - Note combobox model.
        scInstrModel - Instruments table model.
        Returns:
        a singleton SoundcheckController object.

      • getController

        public static SoundcheckController getController()

        Returns the singleton SoundcheckController object.

        Returns:
        SoundcheckController object.

      • itemStateChanged

        public void itemStateChanged(java.awt.event.ItemEvent event)

        Combobox selection listener for the channel combobox. Refills the instruments table based on the new channel and pre-selects the last selected row for this channel.

        Specified by:
        itemStateChanged in interface java.awt.event.ItemListener
        Parameters:
        event - selection change event

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)

        Action listener for the soundcheck window.

        Handles:

        • clicks on the play button
        • changes of the ‘keep settings’ checkbox
        • pressing Enter in one of the text fields
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        e - The event to be handled.

      • sorterChanged

        public void sorterChanged(javax.swing.event.RowSorterEvent e)

        Scrolls to the currently selected instruments table row, if possible. Called when the table string filter or sorter has been changed.

        Specified by:
        sorterChanged in interface javax.swing.event.RowSorterListener
        Parameters:
        e - the row sorter event

      • getLastSelectedTableRow

        public static int getLastSelectedTableRow(int channel)

        Returns the last (remembered) selected table model index of the given channel.

        Parameters:
        channel - The requested channel.
        Returns:
        last selected table (model) row.

      • play

        private void play()

        Plays the customized sound.

      • checkVolOrVelField

        private void checkVolOrVelField(java.lang.String type)
                         throws java.lang.NumberFormatException

        Checks if the volume or velocity textfield contains a usable string.

        If the check succeeds: sets the volume/velocity slider according to the value from the text field.

        Parameters:
        type - volume or velocity, depending on the field to be checked.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the field cannot be used as a volume/velocity value.

      • checkDurationField

        private void checkDurationField()
                         throws java.lang.NumberFormatException

        Checks if the duration textfield contains a usable string.

        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the field cannot be used as a duration value.

      • stateChanged

        public void stateChanged(javax.swing.event.ChangeEvent e)

        Handles volume or velocity slider changes via mouse clicks. Sets the volume or velocity text field’s content to the new value.

        Specified by:

      • changedUpdate

        public void changedUpdate(javax.swing.event.DocumentEvent e)

        Called if one of the text fields has been changed.

        Passes the event to handleTextFieldChanges(DocumentEvent) in order to check the content and adjust the background color.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • handleTextFieldChanges

        private void handleTextFieldChanges(javax.swing.event.DocumentEvent e)

        Called if a text field value changes by one of the according event handlers. Checks the content of the changed field and adjusts the background color according to the check result.

        Parameters:
        e - The event to be handled.

        public void windowOpened(java.awt.event.WindowEvent e)

        Fills the instruments table and the notes list (in the right order) and ensures that in both of them one element is selected.

      • valueChanged

        public void valueChanged(javax.swing.event.ListSelectionEvent event)

        Handles selections of instruments or notes.

        Instruments or drumkits are selected from a MidicaTable. Notes or percussion instruments are selected from a JList.

        Specified by:
        valueChanged in interface javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener
        Parameters:
        event - Table row or list item selection event.
